description.narrative: By 2023, adolescents have increased access to gender sensitive adolescent friendly services., which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Adolescent Empowerment (Covid), Learning Outcomes, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children (Covid), Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2023, adolescents are learning, healthy, developing and participating in an environment free from violence, exploitation and abuse.

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF EDUCATION ARTS AND CULTURE
THE NAMIBIA AIDS TRUST PREVENTION TRUST MOHSS NATIONAL LEVEL

sector.narrative: Adolescents participating in or leading civic engagement initiatives (including in humanitarian settings)
HIV health and community system strengthening to improve access and adherence
Social and behaviour change communication on violence, exploitation and abuse
System strengthening - community participation and social accountability, e.g. school management committees

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2023, adolescents have increased access to gender sensitive adolescent friendly services.

description.narrative: Adolescents increasingly access adolescent-friendly services through demand-creation such as Edu-Circles in schools, teen club interventions near health facilities, Galz & Goals events related to sports and life skills support, and other interventions like the Safer Internet Days and the World's Largest Lesson on child online protection and children's rights in general. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:18/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of young people who received SRH/HIV information and services through UNICEF programming
2. Number of children and adults that have access to a safe and accessible channel to report sexual exploitation and abuse
Adolescents 15-19 who were tested for HIV and received their results in the past 12 months
Number of learners in targeted schools who regularly access "Talk to Edu" (T4D) platform
Existence of a school re-entry policy/strategy for pregnant girls and/or adolescent mothers
